WRITING.TEXT: I finally decided to join the discussion here to give some insight. As some of you might know the plus version of the UP is pretty much all about restaurations, but as we know little of what Troika planned sometimes we have to make stuff up. As for the Malkavian Maze, we found screenshots of the area that showed that it was cut and rebuild them as closely as possible! These areas are at the beginning and the end and we needed something to make the middle interesting. Then I found the broken dome with the hole, a daylight skybox and a concept painting which pretty much looked like the room looks now so I build it in that way. You can find the screenshots and concept art in the patch extras folder restauration document! I figured if Grout is able to keep his wife in some kind of stasis and give claws to his ghouls, he might find a way to simulate daylight as well. As for Kent, this came indeed later as a kind of easter egg, but as Grout was doing experiments to learn more about his "condition", why not use another vampire for this as well?
See above for my intention behind the room and the license. As for Grout, in my opinion he is dead and everything else is illogical!
Visible triggers like these are always sign that you loaded in incompatible save.

Maybe my above comment was a bit harsh, but most people supporting the "Grout is alive idea" ignore that a) he would never have left his wife behind to die in the fire and b) Ming Xiao must have been really stupid and she is the leader of the Kuij-Yin...
I agree with that reasoning. LaCroix did not only send Ming to frame Nines, he probably suspected Grout was dangerous to his plan and got rid of two birds with one stone!

I was completely surprised by the sisters' revelation, but then I was coming from FPSs to Bloodlines where things like this rarely happen. And I too have the impression that the movie Harley Quinn looks very much like Jeanette! Back on topic, the Ocean House is a famous map not only because of it's design, but also because of the intention. Like here you are, powerful force of the night, and suddenly you die because of something you can't even fight!

Very interesting. So who came up with that vampire burning death? I always thought Bloodlines took that from the Blade movies, or was it the other way around too and this was mentioned in the VtM books earlier than in the Blade comics?
I think this is a pretty obvious hommage. They even have a page there with the same words written over and over...
At the time I only played shooters and didn't really know much about Malkavians. The ending caught me by surprise too, I expected just another boss fight. So this was a pleasant surprise :)!

I haven't seen The Lost Boys, or at least I can't remember it ;), but I didn't mean the fact that vampires burn in daylight or on death, but the graphical effect which looks very similar in Blade and Bloodlines.
Getting the magazine mission after the Tawni mission is a feature of the plus patch only...
Indeed this is the case. And Troika had some fun and called them internally "Jets" and "Sharks" :)! The members will fight each other whenever they meet...
That detail was indeed added by the Unofficial Patch plus :)!
These two locations have been merged into one map so the game would not have to load in the middle of the intro!
That is a weird bug we actually needed to recompile the map to fix it. If you still have it, you don't have the patch active! Is the patch version number displayed on your gameplay options tab?
I added another in the smoke shop, but there is only so much you can do without new voice-overs...
This is what I was aiming for. I am a big Sherlock Holmes fan :)!
This is correct, you don't need to reinstall the game or the patch.

We actually thought about this when we moved the tutorial away from the theatre backdoor. I mean if LaCroix would know that Jack is working with the fledgling, he probably would trusted him much less...

This was done to reflect their actual dialogues. In the Last Round Skelter says you should go up and meet Nines, which makes no sense when he is upstairs himself. And Fat Larry claims the is the "man in the alley" and he "saw you coming down the street", all of which he couldn't do in the old position. Besides that he would be selling illegal stuff right in front of a guard and he was shown to be in the alley near Club Confession in the beta too. I don't know why Troika moved them to illogical locations...

This reply was indeed added by the Unofficial Patch because we found no way to fix the exploit of going back and forth to get more XP. Which itself was caused by the restoration of the histories and maybe the reason why Troika disabled them...

I don't believe that. The alley where Larry waits in the plus patch is the number one shortcut through the downtown map and he is visible from Club Confession, Skyeline Appartments and the Empire Hotel. On the other hand in the old place you would only see him when you explored everything! I have another theory on this though: In the new place Larry can be killed by the gang members fighting and I had to work quite a bit to keep that possibility low. As for Damsel and Skelter, if you didn't notice Damsel up there, you wouldn't have noticed Skelter either, so the change doesn't matter...
I think that's exaclty the brilliant thing about the map. Your fierce powerful vampire learns that he just can't kill everything!
If the legacy version works and the patched one doesn't, it could be that the patch cfg file has a higher audio quality set as default which you could change in the config.cfg file...
It seems there was a bug in the computer terminal like if you checked the status it would change instead. Maybe that happened to you? I will fix that in the next UP...
Yeah, that's a cool hidden easter egg which I restored for the plus patch :)!
I wasn't aware that this old game had such activity here. I am monitoring enough boards already ;)!
It seems you need Intimidation 4 to get the name of the collaborator out of him.
Yes, the models and animations were already in the map. I only needed to add a trigger...
As I wrote, I didn't place them into the map, Troika did. Everything was already there, the trigger, the model, the animation, the music. I only called it from the dialogue with the prince!
This is because of Skelter's dialogue: He says about Nines "So then go on up and see him." and that Jack is "That's the man, there." as if he can see him.
That's only a feature of the plus patch for people who want fun and work ;)!
And here I am ;)! Yes, I believe that the cabbie is impersonated by Caine, and no, I don't believe that Grout is alive...
The plus version of the Unofficial Patch offers shortcuts to all endgame mazes...

No. Besides that I often feel it's ridiculous that the hero kills hundreds of harmless guards only to leave the real evil mastermind go free (the Deadpool movie got that right compared to e.g. the lastest James Bond movie), without any special voice overs I don't think I could do much of talking and all of these should have powers to make stealth obsolete!
Your bad sound was probably caused by some weird audio config that the patch fixed. Just check config.cfg and play around with the audio values until you have it back!
Troika did this, maybe because she hasn't any important dialogue anymore?

1) I found Malkavian dialogue there, so the quest was intended to be done by all clans. I balanced by adding options to quests that were not possible by Nosferatu before, like Replanting a Lily. 2) Paradox already asked me for the credits of the Unofficial Patch because they want to include them in the credits of Bloodlines 2! 3) Prelude II development is going fine and faster than Prelude I :). 4) Hypothetically yes, but who would do something like this ;)!
I don't know how much time Prelude II will take. And while the hunter idea was great in part I, the options are rather limited compared to those of all the clans...
There were already some gay/bi characters in the original game, like the guy with the broken car in SM or the food critic in Hollywood. But they were more subtle about it...
Which was added by me in the patch because people asked for it for years! It doesn't make much difference though, as the voice-over is just not there...
Fixed :)!
Is there anything special about your graphics card?
The latest Clan Quest Mod has a completely new hub and a Sabbat questline, so you need to check it out! Also the voice-acting is not spliced but the creator burgermeister paid professionals for it...
If you cited the above line exaclty, the bracket at the end is missing: Dominate 1 amp; (G.Dema\_Go == 0 or G.Dema\_Leave == 1)
Check the number of brackets then, maybe burgermeister messed something up there...

If that Fandom page is like a Wiki, anybody could have changed it. Or is there some canon proof to it? If she really would be 6th generation, LaCroix would surely have brought her into the Camarilla long ago, just to make sure she doesn't go Anarch...
The syntax is like this: male answer, female answer, line to jump to, conditions checked, variables set... If the latter two are swapped it won't work...

Actually this was patched in :)! In the original you can't even hurt the werewolf, which I found illogical so Lenuska helped me to fix that. I don't believe you can kill him with normal weapons without cheating though...
Glad you liked the bit about the puppets, because I had to improvise it together with most of the maze :)!
The AI disabling usually only appears the first time a map loads, after that it should be gone. Also check if you have a graphs folder indside your map folder.
No. If there is no graphs folder the game will rebuild the AI files resulting in the warning message...
Stat errors like this are usually fixed in basic...
Exactly, also Jack's anti-cheat line was added by myself in the patch, because we can't fix the histories exploit...

I agree with most of the answers here except I believe: 2. Like he said in the game Beckett did some more research and learned that the sarcophagus could contain either Messerach or Lamastu, so as both were no Antediluvians something was off and somebody had spread that rumour on purpose. I don't think he knew more than that! 4. In my opinion Nines didn't know anything specific about the sarcophagus either, but I'm sure Jack told him to ignore it and not get the Anarchs caught in the fighting over it. Notice that Nines never mentions the sarcophagus and Damsel and Skelter don't really care as well! 8. My theory is that the whole thing was a test from Caine to see how his childer would react to the promise of endless power in form of the sarcophagus and rising power in form of the player character experiencing it himself. Which probably threw a bad light on vampires ;)!
You would need to edit disciplinetgt\_004.txt and just copy the salvo part of the basic version over the theft version of plus.
To get this you need to install the basic patch into an empty folder with only vampire.exe in it (as the installer looks for it).

You don't even need the basic patch for that. Just go into Unofficial\_Patch\\models\\character\\monster\\animalism\_beastform, remove the animalism\_beastform\* files, copy the animalism\_baastform\* files and rename them to animalism\_beastform\*...
Play the Unofficial Patch plus next time, it includes a shortcut.
How do you know this was supposed to be the main theme?

I hope that they at least keep different colors instead of the minimalistic approach like e.g. The Outer Worlds of just adding the stat in front. And I would rather like different fonts too, they are more stylish!

There is only one guy working on the unofficial patch with the occassional help from others and that is me :)! And I wasn't aware of showing locked stat lines until I saw The Other Worlds and honestly I think the Bloodlines system is better, as you can't min/max the dialogues that way...
Bloodlines does the same only you won't see it most of the time...
You would need to edit the maps or Python files for this and set all the NPCs to patrol certain routes. I wasn't even aware that Troika build some kind of sleep mode into the NPCs :)!
Are you sure Ash isn't already gone and you are trying to talk to his double?
I just looked at the files and if you wait too long, both Ash and the hunter will be gone. But you will see them again later ;)!
Yes, but don't wait too long! The hunters don't have all evening ;).
The humanity loss there was added by the Unofficial patch after much discussion whether it would be more humane to kill them or not...
I would guess there would be some vampire healing to get their eyes back and remove their memoires, also rules are rules, and innocents are innocents...
Exactly. And when I restored this easter egg for the patch I never thought that anybody would overlook it when it appears only to later see it during the endgame :)!
The man on the couch is Mercurio. You can't trust Chunk, he tries to kill you in the end :)!
Exactly! And judging from when LaCroix uses Domination on the player, you would probably see in-game particles above her head if she had used Presence on you.
I believe this was one of the first bugs the Unofficial Patch fixed. Are you using it?
This only includes the official patch, good luck finishing the game with that ;)!

This is done intentional by the Unofficial Patch. Old saves are incompatible and are moved into an "old" folder during installation, as continueing them will break the game! Or did I misinterpret your description and you did not update the UP in the last months?

Which was an especially bad gameplay element as you didn't get anything for eating up enemies and low and behold, you were even able to stop feeding on them in the middle of combat but couldn't prevent draining people dry when undisturbed...
Why are you using the completely outdated UP version 9.4?
You are probably not running the patched game because you did start directly from Steam and not the patch shortcut. In that case you need to correct the Steam launch parameters!
I believe GOG should nowadays be using 10.2 at least...
Of course you can refuse to slash the paintings. Only Jeanette will find someone else to do it and Therese will assume it was you anyway :)!
Does anywhere remember where he is actually called Mr. Damp?
Please give me the correct link, I can't find it...
There are two times you can leave the warrens to resupply but you need to continue nevertheless...
The Unofficial Patch added the missing scene that shows that the player will survive!
It will not duplicate anything, only replace the other files and move you saves into a subfolder, where you can get them out of again.
I don't think that this version includes an ingame UI. It's rather old and I never had the time to include a newer one...
Yukie was not added by the patch, she was made so intentional by Troika! Just remember what the player can say to her after you defeated the Hengeyokai :)!
If the exe doesn't start the installer, the patch download itself might have been corrupted.
Bloodlines is known to act up after long playing session. Just quit, restart und load an earlier save.

Maybe the devs noticed that it would be too difficult, and especially too obvious (I'm looking at Deus Ex here where there always was a convenient vent when you needed one), if there would be three different ways to any place for each of the traversal powers.
Did you update the patch in the middle of your playthrough?
That's Dr. Sheldon LaCroix :)!
Luckily her neck has already been fixed, as you can see in the new trailer :)!
Which is only right and cheap to survive the endless fighting if you didn't build your character for it until then!

Yeah, I remember. The UP fixed that but it wasn't easy as Troika used a kind of cutscene models in which several characters move in synchro. And they forgot that the player might be female or male, but luckily DDlullu could improve that for me!
Make sure you never switch between unpatched and patched game, like always start from the patch shortcut or append the Steam launch options correctly!
The patch never changed anything about this cheat :)!
Then the wiki is probably wrong, I didn't do anything there and wouldn't even know how...
This is quite common in Bloodlines, the outside of buildings hardly fits the inside. Just to stay with the Skyeline Appartments, notice all these windows? None of the flats have them...
Yes, that was the problem. You could only get Christophers secret if you got an invitation which doesn't make sense as you don't need one for the others. So I fixed that for plus...
The transcriptions of the whispers are in the patch extras folder, but you won't be much more smarter after reading them ;).
There is a gate in the big fence. At least I put one there in the UP :)!

Yes, I noticed this myself. I'm a sucker for details like these and plotholes and similar! And I'm not alone in this, just recently I finally managed to fix the tutorial inconsistency with the help of another modder :).
You can visit the back entrance of the Nocturne Theatre in the downtown hub and it looks nothing like in the tutorial! We fixed that by having Jack move with the player to an area somewhat off...
What version of the UP are you using and how are you launching it if not from the shortcut?
Thanks! Because I improvised the whole "Mannequin House" just to restore content we later noticed was actually intended for the Chateau Hotel :).
Yeah, I thought a little surprise at the end wouldn't be too bad ;)!

If you launch from the normal shortcut you shouldn't be able to go back to the museum in the first place. This is a plus patch feature, you couldn't do this in the original game! You might try G.Museum\_Open = 1 in the console before you speak to the cabbie...
Then you probably mistyped. Capitals are important in Bloodlines!

Mixing old saves is always asking for trouble in Bloodlines, better let the item go if you missed it. I only wonder how you could get back there in the first place if you didn't use the patch. The museum location was just still open on the taxi map?
Can you send me that autosave somehow, so I could take a look?
Weird...
This sounds as if you did play with the patch active! Type G.Patch\_Plus in the console and post the result here, please.
Are you playing the unpatched game from Steam or the unofficially patched from GOG? Can you open the console (\~ key from the menu) and post any error messages here?
Malkavian talk to the Stop sign and the news caster. Nosferatu get several unique reactions, like from Doris in the Diner.

Exactly. I actually know that CCP, who owned the WW rights before they were sold to Paradox, shut down a fan project attempting to recreate Bloodlines 1 in other engines before. When Paradox got the rights, the idea was discussed immediately but Activision didn't care, so for now the rights are hanging in limbo.
So what exactly happens if you start it from the shortcut?
As far as I know they already tried but without success. One problem of course is that the original Bloodlines still sells very well, so why do a remake in the first place?
Have you set a bad resolution or did it never start with the patch?
Presence does show up in dialogue if you use the Plus Patch. For Dominate and other multi level disciplines I use the mouse wheel to select the level I want...
Oh, you want to get them first. Indeed vstats buy does work for dialogues too...
There is a megamod called Age of Redemption, but I don't know exactly if it is more a patch or a mod.
I never heard that before. Is the patch really running? Like is the version number displayed on the game options page?
Can you open the console with the \~ key and post what is listed there?
This is plus patch only so once again the wiki is wrong. I'll fix that...
Did you set the resolution to one your monitor does not support?
If you use the Unofficial Patch in the plus version you get shortcuts for the sewer levels and most of the endgame fights :)!

I don't think the ending was cut and I don't think Beckett is in on the whole thing, only the Anarchs are. But listen to what Johansen has to say and you know that something is off! I bet Beckett just came to the same conclusion...

My theory is that Troika just forgot to record specific Nines lines for that scene. So they used some common lines that exist for all mayor NPCs instead! In fact I found another unused line that works much better and restored it for the plus patch...
It is in the UP, but only the plus version. I think CE Final is based on basic and the CQM has it's own different kind of way to skip the sewers.
Just a small correction, this was already in the original game and I assume he used one of his grenades. Maybe put it in the werewolfes mouth using Celerity :)!
See above, Nines killing a werewolf was already in the original game.
Exactly, I only restored the Chateau Hotel map, the rest is original!

Sadly it's not true. All big mods use the same seperate-folder-system the UP introduced so there is no need to uninstall anything when adding a mod to the GOG version. Also this has no DRM and doesn't need to have Steam run in the background so I would always go for it!
Yes, I added the laptop in the Unofficial Patch plus to give players a hint. The easter egg itself was already there, only nobody would ever find it without the tip :)!
Yes, I added that for the plus patch as I found it illogical that you can't even hurt him. But I don't think it's possible to kill him without cheating...

It is a common misunderstanding that Mercurio is LaCroix's ghoul. He isn't, otherwise he wouldn't be able to help you in the endgame. His master is someone in the Venture Tower, but his lines imply that it isn't LaCroix himself.
Just for your interest, if you get Yukie to fight with you at the temple in the UP plus, with a very high Persuasion you can skip all the inside areas except for Ming herself.

For me it was the story telling and writing. From the sister's secret to the surprise at the end! Clearly for once the writers knew where they were going and I really love that. Like in good old Babylon 5 and not like in Game of Thrones or the SW sequels...
I think it's possible as a Nossie to have sex with Jeanette in the original game and the UP. After all she even had some with Tung, as both her computer and Therese confirms!

If you installed the plus version of the Unofficial Patch you can skip a lot of the endgame fighting. Also if you build your character correctly, you might breeze through it with all the powers you got by that time!
I see the problem that you can't leave the floor without using the elevator or maybe a staircase with many locked doors so that would slow you down.
You must also have met Bishop Vick...
You need to run the patch installer itself, not put files into the vampire folder...
The laughter comes out of the dressing room of the girls, so what is the problem with the strippers having some fun in their free time? Sometimes you can even see girls leave and enter.
No, this is original content. The girls are using cocaine and the guy obviously fell asleep after having some fun...
The differences are not so much. The latest UP is 10.7 and the GOG release comes with 10.2! Especially if you play the first time with basic it shouldn't matter.
These sounds are called Environmental/People/Laughter\_Female\*.wav...
Your problem is that you continued an old save which the patch clearly state you mustn't do! This is one of the side effects, so better start a new game.

You are playing the plus patch now, in which the doctor will not deliver the blackmail money to your home adress, which would be stupid, but to Mercurio's building. Look behind the plants in the corridor there...
Are there some Python errors in the console?
You won't find the textures themselves there, they are original Troika content and still in the VPK archives. But you could use the VPKTool to extract them from there...
Yeah, the Steam folder structure is quite stupid. The game should be in Steam\\steamapps\\common\\vampire... but you must know where you installed Steam in the first place!
You need to open any doors at the Luckee Strike about 16 times in the latest patch version, a little less in earlier ones...
While the player probably won't care about the old pizzas, I was convinced by somebody that Heather must find them disgusting so I made her throw them away in the patch :)!
Yeah, this is one of the unused tracks that Rik Schaffer made available to me for the UP :)!
Yes, I am :)!
Which movie is this from?
Just gift me some Steam coins or how the Steam currency is called.
Usually this kind of thing happens if you play too long sessions in one go. Just quit the game, restart and load an earlier save...
I never before saw that it happened to somebody in the netcafe, but the similar bug in the Skyeline Appartments was well known before the Unofficial Patch was even out...
Actually the father/mother lines are just switched according to the player gender.
That usually mean that your GPU can't handle transparency like you are running with an on-board graphics chip or similar.
Theoretically yes, but you need to ask that to Intel ;).
This is restored content from the Plus Patch and you will meet him again later :)!
This was already in the original game, many bums do it on all the maps...
Huh? He should only be visible in the plus patch. Are you sure you didn't select it while installing? If you did you should also have the Bloodheal discipline...
Bloodheal was not in the original game, but it might be in the CQM. The new UP plus library quest is in the CQM though and this guy is connected...
Almost ;). There was a hidden vampire there called watchman, but I created the model myself out of an unused texture and a normal model and I connected him to the library quest...

It does restore almost everything that we could possibly restore. There is a full list in the patch readme, I'll copy the top points here: Levels: \+ Smoke Shop. \+ Coffee Shop. \+ Chateau Hotel. \+ Public Library. \+ Malkavian Maze. \+ Museum Entrance. \+ Warrens Shortcut. \+ Hallowbrook Atrium. #8203; Endings: \+ Joining Sabbat ending. \+ Easter egg wolf ending. #8203; Quests: \+ Drug quest from Trip. \+ Library quest from Beckett. \+ Gary poster quest for name plate. \+ Gary poster quest for fleshy ball. \+ Gary poster quest for throwing star. \+ Gary poster quest for squashed chalice. #8203; Disciplines: \+ Bloodheal discipline. \+ Sleep instead of Suicide. \+ Madness as Bedlam partial. \+ Spirit Heal Numina for hunters. \+ Faith Shield Numina for hunters. \+ Bloody Eye as Blood Purge partial. \+ Blood Theft instead of Blood Salvo. \+ Blood Malady as Blood Theft partial. \+ Active discipline casting animations. \+ New disciplines available from Beckett. \+ Toreador and Brujah Presence in dialogue. \+ Tremere first level Domination in dialogue. #8203; Weapons: \+ Broadsword in the library. \+ Sheriff sword from Sheriff. \+ Dragon's Breath from Mercurio. \+ Tiger's Claws from Claw Brother. \+ Fragmentation grenade from Nines. \+ Pyro crossbow from several enemies. \+ Shin Gunto swords from several enemies. \+ SWAT sniper rifle from Mercurio or Bach. #8203; Powerups: \+ Occult Wits powerup in Kamikaze Zen level. \+ Occult Obfuscate powerup in Nosferatu haven. \+ Occult Charisma powerup as reward from Isaac. \+ Occult Security powerup as reward from Mr. Ox. #8203; Items: \+ Fleshy ball in King's Way. \+ Charity money box in gallery. \+ Name plate in Kamikaze Zen safe. \+ Throwing star on Red Dragon desk. \+ Driver's license in Malkavian Maze. \+ Eight at first unknown occult items. \+ Driver's license from Simon Milligan. \+ Wooden pulltoy in Metalhead Industries. \+ Library card found in the new library level. \+ Chewing gum sellable to Copper found on pier. \+ Vacuum tubes box found in the new library level. \+ Squashed Odious Chalice hidden inside Fu Syndicate. \+ Models for Colt Anaconda and Desert Eagle magazines. \+ Models for Dane report, screenplay, cd and three books. #8203; Encounters: \+ Kiki at Red Dragon. \+ Guard dog at the beachhouse. \+ Male blood doll at Red Dragon. \+ Security guard in the tutorial. \+ Yukie helping in first temple map. \+ Last dialogue at Hallowbrook hotel. \+ Meeting Skelter during Anarch endgame. \+ Security guards at Empire Arms hotel entrance. \+ Sewer-cabbie rat for Malkavians in downtown hub. \+ Security guard and sequence at Skyeline Apartments. #8203; Options: \+ Venus' computer at Confession. \+ Laptop and note at Luckee Star. \+ Santa Monica pier end accessable. \+ Sending Gimble or Patty to Vandal. \+ Timed explosion of Dominated bomber. \+ Dance spots at Glaze and Empire hotel. \+ Revisiting possible of seven locations. \+ Bertram's CD quest available to all clans. \+ Vandal's Lily quest available to Nosferatu. \+ Arthur's and Bertram's computers accessible. \+ Talking to thugs and killer phoning in diner. \+ Private dancing from VV and Misti at Vesuvius. \+ Having fun with Jeanette possible one more time. \+ Improved handling of Empire Arms keycard printer. \+ Warrens, Hallowbrook, Temple and Venture shortcuts. \+ Imalia's magazine quest available after Tawni quest. \+ Romero and Pimpin' quest available after zombie quest. \+ Redundant items can be given to Lily, LaCroix and others. #8203; Situations: \+ Hollywood sweeper fighting back. \+ One dog and Lasombra at junkyard. \+ Giovanni spirits in Giovanni crypt. \+ Sheriff using Bloodsucker Communion. \+ Two actors being killed at Ground Zero. \+ Cat and Sabbat leader sequence at King's Way. \+ Special sequences on all hubs and at Vesuvius. \+ Rat crowd and spiderchick sequences in warrens. \+ Female crying, broken limo and Obfuscator on SM hub. \+ Hellcat, valve and sprinkler sequences at Ocean House. \+ DJ, barkeeper, cage dancers and turnstile at Confession. \+ Boss, forklift accident and Beckett leaving at warehouse.
No, this is a Sabbat internally called "Obfuscator" and you'll meet him once you move downtown, but Nines takes care of him :)!

Yeah, there is some stuff in the plus patch that is more about personal taste ;). As for Bertram's quest, I played as a Toreador and ended up with a CD item I had no use for which puzzled me a lot! So I fixed that. Also a lot of these restoration have aspects that we needed to improvise as we didn't really know how e.g. the library map would have looked if Troika had done it or how the drug quest would have played out. Therefore I moved all of this in the optional plus patch! Maybe I should create a video about the differences and whatever is behind them?

If you read Scott's diary and connect the dots it becomes obvious that this Lasombra is trying to recruit ghouls and vampires into the Sabbat and the caitiff at the junkyard was a suitable candidate. Then you as the private agent of the prince appear there and he decides that it is too risky to confront you...
I had Celerity and firearms maxed out in the end and was like Neo in the Matrix :)!
You will find the SDK and other tools and tutorials in the Extras folder of the Unofficial Patch.
This is most probably just a bug which makes some NPCs speed across a map after level change which makes them look as if they use Celerity.
There are still a lot of minor random bugs that we just can't fix because they are random...
I always use the shortcut I added for the Unofficial Patch plus :)!

Sadly this was a bug of 10.7 RC2 which has been resolved in later release candidates. Sadly I can't recommend to install the newer versions on top on your current game as this would probably break your saves...
That is a feature I found hidden in the game files which I restored for the plus patch!
The UP includes the ENB and SweetFX shader suits in the Extras folder, but you need to install them yourself.
The lines show the missing texture colors, so there is certainly something messed up!

This is what Boyarsky said in an interview with RPGCodex in 2004: "What features would you have like to have included in Bloodlines, if money, time and manpower wasn't an issue? I think that if you asked any developer that question, they'd say they'd like to implement every last detail that they originally envisioned for the game, but was just not feasible due to money/time constraints. For us specifically, we would have loved to have given the player the opportunity to play one of the independent clans, or even go over to the sabbat side, but that would have necessitated making at least three different games in one. And don't get me started on Diablerie..." I believe they didn't work concretely on this because of the reason he mentioned. But I don't think it was an accident that one endgame story state was unused, as if they reserved it for a possible expansion. So I improvised a Sabbat ending and burgermeister added a whole Sabbat questline...
You mean the one with the quest for the Pearl of Dubai? Yeah, that would be cool, but I would guess they are already lost in time forever...
Just add -game Unofficial\_Patch to the Steam launch options.

Here are links to the two E3 presentation reports. If they were indeed accurate ;)... [http://www.rpgamer.com/event/e3-2003/impressions/imp-vtm-jscott.html](http://www.rpgamer.com/event/e3-2003/impressions/imp-vtm-jscott.html) [http://www.gamespot.com/articles/vampire-the-masquerade-bloodlines-e3-2004-preshow-impressions/1100-6095269/](http://www.gamespot.com/articles/vampire-the-masquerade-bloodlines-e3-2004-preshow-impressions/1100-6095269/)

AFAIK Brian Mitsoda joined the team after the main storyline was set. I already asked him a lot of what he remembered about some cut content and most of the time he wasn't yet there yet when it was cut.
Sorry, I never used a Steam controller, so I have no idea about that.

I completely disagree. There is no proof at all that Beckett is in on this with Jack! Beckett is a known loner who has no connections to the Anarchs, so why should Jack trust him? I'm pretty sure Jack told Nines and the Anarchs not to care about the sarcophagus, and they don't among all factions in Bloodlines, but in my opinion Beckett did some research himself and figured out that something was wrong. And he warns the player because like Rosa said, he and Mercurio are the only people the player can trust. Strauss is just too carefull to open the sarcophagus and Andrei sinks it into the ocean because this is what the Sabbat would do with a powerfull elder.

You shouldn't forget that the whole "Kuei-Jin trying to take over LA" plot is based on the PnP game, so Troika just ran with that. This is also valid for the behaviour of Nines and Skelter which has to do with the Anarch movement and not their races. Yukie is an obvious parody of Hentai girls and the author of that article actually forgot to mention the black drug dealer Dennis at the beachhouse, so I would guess she wrote it all because she suffers from racism herself and projected it onto the game.

In the WoD PnP game the Kuei-Jin are the Asian invaders so WW should be to blame, not Troika. Also some people could write an article that LaCroix is a typical French bad guy, not fighting on his own, or that Bach has a German background, but someone needs to be the bad guy so you won't ever be able to please everybody ;)!
If you talked with Vandal in Bloodlines you pretty soon found out that he is a sick bastard. But how do you know he is Mr. Damp?
I hope to do beta-testing for Bloodlines 2 so a patch will not be necessary ;). About making a vamp out of a ghoul, I'm pretty sure that's possible but I am no WoD expert.
The SM haven has windows because most flats do, I find it rather more curious that the Skyeline appartments have none. And there are boards on the floor to cover the windows during the day...
I never really noticed that and it does indeed look weird, so I fixed it for the next patch version :)! After all with Celerity it should be easy enough for Nines to be there right on time.
This isn't illogical. If you check out the cellar you will notice he has cameras set up in all appartments.

Uh, maybe I can fix that... P.S.: I just checked this and it shouldn't be possible. The guard below is hidden and a new one is unhidden in the flat. I don't see how the new one could know the old one should be dazed ;)!
Yeah, but this would have been too obvious, also boards to block the windows are there. I guess he hoped the player would be killed either at the beachhouse or the warehouse.
Honestly, Yukie and her quest are pretty much a parody on typical anime, so who would take her seriously?
Yeah, you are right. Still he knew that Mercurio is involved with shady people to get the explosives...
How did you walk out? If you entered via the vents and left that way, I don't think you ever meet him :)!
A small file is included in the UP extras to make the Malkavian font better readable...
Which was sadly unfinished in the original game so I had to restore it in the UP :)!
I just tested this on my system and he enters the flat in body just fine :)!

I think it's obvious she reflects the same behaviour she experienced herself onto the game regarding Asian people. I for example do not do this with Bach and his German origin, because a game is a game and cliches exist for a reason...
Yes, I left him dazed first and yes, the memory leak could probable be the reason for anything there ;)!
No, he is not. This was just a speculation of a fan which ended up in the Wiki...
As this error is an indication of an incompatible save in the first place and you are not far anyway, better start a new game!
Oh, I thought you just started. In that case try to finish the game without blood packs ;)!
Can you please tell me what quest this is supposed to be?
Whatever this is, this is not part of the patch. Do you have any texture mods installed?
That would be give item\_g\_bloodpack or give item\_g\_bluebloodpack.
That depends on the Unofficial Patch version you are playing.
In the current UP version you need a name plate. I can be that in some earlier versions it was the fleshy ball, but I moved that to be the last quest as people used to not find it...
Are you even playing the plus patch then?

Rik can be reached via the email below and in my experience he is a really cool guy very free giving about his music. He made a lot of unused tracks available for the UP so just ask him nicely ;)! [rschaffer@wombmusic.net](mailto:rschaffer@wombmusic.net)
I never saw that before, also how do you manage to run up the stairs without them collapsing?

Regarding the voice-acting, I know that burgermeister, the creator of the CQM mod, paid professionals for some of the main roles! This might explain differences in quality, because I would guess others were voiced by friends of his. Also while I liked the Sabbat storyline and the new hub in general, I really disliked the LaCroix Domination event for which there was no indication and the stupid combat against the Anarchs, especially the one in the boring dark arena. To me it's obvious that Jack told them about his plan and they would never fight for the sacrophagus. They basically ignore it in the original game which should be hint enough!
I think the photo shows one of the developers so it certainly is an easter egg.
Could very well be, I don't know exactly who that is...
The Clan Quest Mod and the Unofficial Patch can be installed and run in parrallel on the same game setup, but if you merge them, the game will break!
Hm, I can't remember adding more guards to the Dane...

If you install both the UP and the CQM you will get two shortcuts which will start each of them from the same Bloodlines installation. By merging I meant installing the UP into the CQM folder or the other way around which is not recommended!
You can show the licence to Patty to make her trust you easier, but nothing more.
That whole quest line was improvise by me, I have no idea what Troika had planned there...

Yeah, working for 15 years on a game can do that ;). As for the library quest, it grew with the time, but we didn't have much info about what was planned there. Brian Mitsoda only remembered it was about a main character (Beckett) and an optional Sabbat boss. So we build something like this...

Indeed I removed the "anarch" from that line in the UP because subtitles did not match the spoken words. Also why should LaCroix call your sire an "a loyal and upstanding member of our organization" if he was Anarch? This wouldn't make sense, so in my opinion Troika cut this in the voice-over and just forgot to fix the subtitles... As for the sire and his strange behaviour, we will try to explain that in the Prelude mod :)!
I'm interested to hear what you found a mistake in the CQM Sabbat storyline. I disliked some aspects myself and would like to know if others share the same opinion.
Another easy way is to look at the sound/schemes files and remove the music there.
Yes, both of them will be around a lot :)!

Interesting. I for one didn't like the sudden Domination of LaCroix and the multiple fights against the Anarchs, one of them even in the chantry. For the Domination there was no hint although you always got particle effects when LaCroix did it in the original game and as I explained elsewhere I strongly believe that Jack told the Anarchs what was in the sarcophagus and that they shouldn't bother with it which they do in the original game. Also if you think it would be difficult to kill a Nosferatu primogen in his lair, I bet it would be impossible to kill Strauss in the chantry, he could just never let you reach him using his teleports! And the ugly dark fighting arena there was much below all other maps in matter of quality. Were the voice-overs for Nines and others still missing when you played it? And what do you think the Sabbat would have done to an Antediluvian? In the UP Sabbat ending I made Andrei lower the sarcophagus into the sea, but more or less only because I had to use the existing ending scenes.

About Jack and the Dane. I agree that he swapped the C4 with the corpse there, why should he have brought the corpse back to LA if he did it elsewhere? Also I can imagine him killing some kine for a big plan like this. Which wasn't his in the first place, as he says to the Cabbie in the end: "Hey, it happened just like you said. They never even knew what hit 'em."
If you use the plus unofficial patch you can actually travel back to the mansion to get it...

gt;If you mean where it's revealed you were a sleeper, I'd forgotten about that. I meant that, yes. It's not only the Domination without particles, but also that the mod just teleports you to him. Honestly while beta testing the mod, I first thought this was a bug! It would have been better if e.g. you were forced to walk there. gt;Since you still attack the Kue-Jin and take the key if you side with the Anarchs... ... which still is in the main interest of them and Jack, so why should they stop you? I would only think that Jack would prevent his friends Damsel, Nines and Skelter from getting killed for this hoax. gt;If you mean the endgame battles, yes. Ah, that's a shame. I told burgermeister if he couldn't get voices there, he better remove the whole black arena fight altogether, but he didn't listen. He loves to kill main NPCs off, I'll guess ;)! gt;There's a Sabbat ending in UOP? Yes, if you are low humanity when you meet Andrei the first time you can talk with him about joining the Sabbat. You can then latter skip the whole Hallowbrook fight and will get a new ending which is a mix of the Camarilla and Kueij-Yin cutscenes...

gt; If you don't know what's in it, you might conceivably open it for any reason ranging from curiosity to ambition (which isn't incompatible with Anarchs). Most of the time you can't because you don't have the key and once you have it, you can open it only in LaCroix's presence. So yes, the Anarchs would sacrifice you! gt; I think it's to give full resolution to the major characters on that route. Like I said, burgermeister likes to kill major characters off for no special reason ;)! gt; I suspect because it's so simple to keep Humanity up and there aren't any bonuses for low Humanity (and not frenzy-ing is important and free choice of dialogue enjoyable), that tends not to get encountered and mentioned by most players using Plus. Maybe I should remove the Humanity condition but it's only at lower than 5...
\*Exactly. In the CQM a lot of main characters behave stupid so they can be killed :)!
Yes, I knew about Bloodlines 2 before anybody else besided the press :).
I hope to be part of beta testing so it doesn't need 15 years of patching ;)!
I added this for the plus patch so if you played basic before it just wasn't there ;)!
This is an easter egg that was already in the original game, but I made it easier to find in the Unofficial Patch :)! If you got this, you can also get another easter egg at the ending...
This seems to be a random glitch, maybe connected to playing long sessions in one go which always messes up the Skyeline Appartment map first!
I don't think it's possible to confront her about this.
"Remember, wherever we go, it is the blood of Caine which makes our fate."
Nice summary. Citing Jack: "Hey, it happened just like you said. They never even knew what hit 'em. Threw that sarcophagus out there and they just tore each other up tryin' to get to it."
Pisha will leave right before you meet with Jack after Griffith park, so you missed her. Maybe I will delay this a bit in the next UP...
What do you mean by Easter egg Anarch ending? I only know one Easter egg ending and it has nothing to do with the Anarchs :)!
Your symptons imply that you either continued an incompatible save or merged the CQM and the UP which doesn't work.

The reasoning behind the change was what would happen if Malcolm talked with his wife and then went to the police? With your adress given, some cops might have appeared there during the day, let some sunlight in and it would have been final death for you. As for the location, there is no other mailbox so I had to find a reasonable hiding place nearby but in another building...
This sometimes happens to me to, quiting the game and restarting it usually fixes this!

Sorry, but I disagree and so did the guy who suggested the change to me. There isn't even a need for Malcolm to tell about the black mail when calling the police. He could just send them to your adress with some fake reason! Also I don't know much about surgeons but I bet they don't have their wallet in their scrubs. As for Mercurio, yes, this would be kind of risky if Malcolm sends the cops there. But Mercurio is a ghoul so he could handle them :)!
There is a good chance you don't even know who Mercurio is when you blackmail Malcolm.

Yeah, "good chance" was an exaggeration :), but the possibility exists. You won't believe what I have experienced stupid players doing in this game! But I had a good idea: How about I move the money into Malcolm's office and let the player say something that he will collect it later? Both he and Malcolm know where that is and Malcolm can't just get the police to wait there in case you show up. At least I can't imagine a reason for that...

We agree that Malcolm has no money in his scrubs and that nobody would be stupid enough to give his real adress in a blackmailing attempt, so this is my compromise. I already made it happen, if you don't like it remember it's just a game!

Andrei even mentions the player's blood being more potent on the second meeting. So besides the obvious player-character-bonus, I can only cite the Cabbie from the ending: "Remember, wherever we go, it is the blood of Caine which makes our fate. Farewell, vampire." :)
Are you using a HD texture mod? This is known to crash the game at some points.
No need to delete anything, just install the plus patch over your current setup.
I never experienced console crashes, but when you don't open the console out of the menu the game freezes. To fix it, type "chareditor" and continue from there...
According to Beckett's Jyhad Diary, Jack has gone back to his pirate roots and is in Libertatia on Madagaskar.

Sadly, this seems to be a hard-coded engine limitation. It's also the reason why I did the Tremere check using Thaumaturgy, because this works, but as Dominate and Thaumaturgy can have different levels it's limited to one.

The code to check for Thaumaturgy is in the dlg files, it normally looks like this in the condition section: Thaumaturgy 1 amp; G.Patch\_Plus == 1 As for switching clans via the console. I don't think that this is possible without the game switching all other things like models and stats as well.
I never changed any of the cheat codes and this one is new to me. Are you sure you don't mix this up with another game?
It isn't mentioned in the ModDev Guide as well, maybe it only worked for official 1.0 or 1.1 and was removed in 1.2?
Please report this issue to the French translator of the patch, maybe he can fix it.
That's the most infamous Bloodlines bug which is caused by playing long sessions in one go. Quit the game, restart it and load an earlier save!

I just want to mention that according to Twitter and LinkedIn the two German producers were moved away from Bloodlines 2 as well, so how high is the probability that four people in two different companies on different continents did some inexcusable things at the same time?
That's excactly it, I have no idea why the Presence line use the Dementation font...
If it might have no impact on the game's final form, why fire him in the first place?
Were outfits not already offered as preorder bonus or something?
Sadly, nobody has any idea. We even recompiled the Skyeline Haven map without results.
Also what about the DLCs and expansions? I doubt that Brian has already written them, should anybody else do them now?

Besides that I believe that Unreal 4 engine games are much harder to mod than Source engine games, I don't know if HSL would leave cut Mitsoda stuff in the game files after they have fired him. I almost got the impression that the whole lot of unused stuff hidden in the Bloodlines 1 game files was left on purpose to show how unfinished they were forced to release the game.

As far as I know burgermeister isn't actively working on CQM anymore, he actually took a look at Unreal 4 modding in anticipation of Bloodlines 2. Maybe he is willing to take a look at CQM again after the recent news ;)...
The video tape is very hard to find, it's down at the big screen.
Yeah, but I made that up. I don't know if he woud rather do something else :)!
The tape is just an item, completely unconnected to anything about the Gargoyle.
Indeed, and I'm still not finished with Bloodlines 1 and it seems that modding Unreal 4 is even worse, so I'll probably out of the question ;)!
They already made several game playing in the Moscow Metro system, you know?
Just show me some Unreal 4 engine game where mods exist. Bloodlines modding was difficult enough...
That's the same thing the Bloodlines 2 producers told me. Who are now gone from the project...

The justicar is an unused male model which I restored to the Camarilla ending where it fits in my opinion. I didn't know about the doppelganger agents, but I restored the model with that name as a Sabbat female into the Hallowbrook hotel.

Exactly. The best proof for stupid company decisions was releasing the original Bloodlines on the same day as Half-Life 2 while keeping Troika from fixing things beforehand. But I agree with the overall suspicion, that the writing must have contained something not appropriate in the eyes of Paradox. Remember how they shut White Wolf down?
Yeah, but I don't really want do it once more ;)!
This sounds to me as if you continued an incompatible save...

Ask Mercurio about Troika Games in Bloodlines and he says: "RPG house, not in LA; it's in Irvine, a little south. Tim Cain, Leonard Boyarsky, and Jason Anderson are the major players. Workin' on a secret project, I don't know much about it. Camarilla's concerned they know too much."
You are pointing the installer to the wrong folder, make sure it's on the correct drive!
Of course you can use earlier saves, but not those done with other patch versions.

If your speculation is true, why would these doppelgangers need a unique model in the first place? They would need to look like the player character after all. Also the male doppelganger who looks like a normal thug, is already used a a player standin, so this could also be just the case from a technical point of view.
As I wrote there, if the stairway is blocked somehow you would be out of luck even with Celerity. But what about Fortitude 5? Could it keep you alive?
Jack had the key right from the start when he set the whole thing up.
Unless Celerity makes you fly too, this wouldn't do much good :)!
Yes, you already get fall damage in the game.
No HD texture mod? This is known to cause many loading crashes...
This is a typical symptom if you continued an incompatible save, like from an unpatched version or earlier patch.

The crashes usually happen with a combination of HD texture mod and other mods, maybe without SweetFX you are fine. If it happens again, you can deinstall the HD mod and still continue your old saves...

There are several thick security guard models that look similar to Chunk. Also he says in the game "My father, father's father, my six brothers, yeah, we're all real keen on upholding the law. Like a family of Magnum PIs."
Yeah, because he wears sunglasses ;). But he talks nothing like Chunk :)!
There is a free lockpick at the Sabbat warehouse...
You can have Beckett teach you Fortitude in the plus version of the Unofficial Patch.
You need to have a Humanity of at least 8 and mustn't be Gangrel or Ventrue.
No.

That was actually one of the first things I asked the Paradox community manager at the time. Calling it Bloodlines 2 only works to get a connection with a known classic when you know that Brian Mitsoda is involved. So if they rewrite it, they can rename it as well ;)!

It seems the wrong aura of Ming Xiao was indeed an oversight, I will fix it to be the same as all the other Kueij-Yin in the next Unofficial Patch version. Other monsters like zombies, the Gargoyle or the Hengeyokai do show a white aura similar to humans and animals but a bit different as they are internally set as supernatural.
I added some Asian chanting for the plus patch that I found unused in the game files. You can find it under Area\\Chinatown\\Temple\\Asian\_Chanting1.wav with three others...
Indeed, and it most often happens at the Skyeline Appartsments. I haven't seen it in the Lotus Blossom before!
If you replay with the Unofficial Patch plus, you get some shortcuts for all this endgame fighting.
If you really want to profit from frenzying, you need to install the Unofficial Patch, as in the original game these stat bonuses did not actually work in frenzy!
That bug has nothing to do with the Antitribu Mod, it happens in the normal game too sometimes.
If you are playing RC7 nothing important has changed, so you better finish that playthrough.

I get VTMBup107.1exe from ModDB which is the latest one (the .1 version updated some SDK files which are not necessary for playing). If the lift to the Hallowbrook is not working you must have swapped between different version, vanilla, basic or plus saves, it's a typical symptom.

As a public club not connected to any vampire the Glaze must be a Maquerade zone. But you don't get any Humanity losses for killing Tongs, so changing anything should not be necessary. Just mind collateral damage ;)!
I think you already loose Humanity for sending him to Pisha, so you would effectively gain two points for setting him free, and I fixed this in the last patch update.
Maybe because people could assume it would be the same fake mess as witch hunting?

A mod like this shouldn't be too difficult as clan parameters like starting disciplines are all set in plain text files that you can find in the vdata/system folder, like clandoc000.txt or traiteffects000.txt.

If you never played Bloodlines before you should start with the Unofficial Patch only, maybe even with basic which is close to the original game. I would suggest to replay with plus or the Clan Quest Mod latter. Also SweetFX and ENB shader suites are in the UP extras if you want some graphical updates...

I don't think many things were cut for a reason, I always like to cite Tim Cain here: "They (Activision) wanted to cut areas of complexity, we wanted to maintain quality, and the game was caught in a lopsided tug-of-war. In the end, Activision #8220;won #8221;, and the game was shipped with many bugs, cinematic cutscene issues, and incomplete areas." lt;- INCOMPLETE AREAS
Yes, it takes a little bit of effort to get through the turnstile but some people have problems in real life with these too ;). If you really can't handle it, ask Venus to get rid of the thing...
Yeah, that was kind of a completist restoration as I saw it clearly in a screenshot ;). Still I am aware that some people have problems so I added the option to remove it...

Yes, but Bloodlines is clearly more unfinished than most games because of the known development problems. So if you would want to only restore stuff exactly the way it would have been intended, no restoration projects could exist at all, as even the developers sometimes don't remember! Like I asked Brian Mitsoda about the library quest and used all the info he gave me. Therefore you have the choice between basic and plus. Also there are many things we didn't restore, just check the patch readme...

Sorry, but the turnstile was made for me by another modder and I will honour his contribution. Only a handful of people among the thousands that download the patch complain and for those I added the option to have Venus remove it, so you would only need to once go in and once go out :)!

I think the TFN thing you don't like, requiring high investments in Investigation to find even quest objects, could easily be fixed by changing some Python code. Just search [vamputil.py](https://vamputil.py) for "inspection" and you might find the script...
See the Tim Cain statement above. Cuts may often be creative decisions, but he claims they were not in the case of Bloodlines!

Maybe Troika left it out because they didn't get the physics to work. I couldn't either, but another modder could. Also this is less sunk cost reasoning than cutting something because a handful of people don't like it and get very public about it!
Nice idea :)! If some more people complain and if I need to update the patch again, it would be an easy thing to do...
In the original game the TV wasn't working at all, but I restored at least the sound in the Unofficial Patch so the Nosferatu player can get some sense of what is going on :).
That's the infamous Skyeline Haven bug, probably caused by a memory leak and happening after you play long sessions. Just quit the game, start it again and load an earlier save.

Yes, the UP+ adds a the Sabbat ending which is a mix of the Camarilla and the Kuij-Yin endings. In this Andrei appears before you can open the sarcophagus and he sinks it to the ocean floor, only this time you are not chained to it.
Did you start your second session from the UP shortcut?
The only plus patch restoration in the Hallowbrook hotel is the atrium which you can actually use to skip the rest if you know how ;)!

I disagree completely. You just make all this stuff up with no proof behind it :)! If you had listened to his tapes you would have known that Grout is just mad with not an inch of the rational thinking necessary to pull anything like this off. Besides not having any powers to do it in the first place. Also we will show in the Prelude what really happened ;)...
Of course not, we make it up as we go too, but more logical than this guy ;)!
Well, this fan theory is very far off towards the ridiculous and I think it has been discussed here often enough why. Also I'm really annoyed about the Grout conspiracy people ;)!

I don't like the pink background and hearts, which reminds me about her trigger warning suggestions somehow ;), but the rest looks like good old interactive fiction, which we called graphics adventures in the days before it all moved to point and click. So at least she might be aware that there are games where writing is more important than graphics...
There were some respawning enemies from empty rooms in the original game, but I removed those in the UP as to me this breaks immersion big time!
I can't remember but there is a relay that should kill the spawner and the zombies.
Yes, hunters still respawn and other enemies too, where it makes sense. Like the zombies at the cemetery or the cops on the hubs...
EntenSchreck made me an improved version of the turnstile which is easier to navigate by pushing. I will include it in the next patch update!
This is wrong. Auspex raises Perception, also in the original game, which is part of the Ranged Weapon feat!
\_\_main\_\_.FindPlayer().SetQuest("Heather",2)
Paradox already thought about this but they didn't get the rights from Activision.
I don't know if the Antitribu Mod uses the auto-speed toggle from the UP. Check autoexec.cfg to see if it is there and if it is, check config.cfg or game options for the key (default INS in the UP).

I can only answer that for my own Unofficial Patch: According to the walkthrough the original Bloodlines has about 42 side quest. The plus patch adds a small one (in one known location) and a large one (in four new or enhanced locations). Also four new poster quests and a new ending...

While I basically agree, in the case of Bloodlines the game still sells quite well after all these years so why should Activision spend any money to create something that might not even be better in the end?
